author: jochembrouwer
content: Correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't this the same logic as for 1559? There is the maxFeePerGas (checked upon txPool) and then at some point the actual fee is deducted (which thus could be *much less* than the max fee) (in this case thus the data fee) (so maxFeePerGas -> maxFeePerDataGas in this case)

author: marioevz
content: Not really, I think this can be improved, what did you have in mind? I'm thinking of starting a client, then build the chain with one of them, start a second one and then instructing this one to do a checkpoint sync to the first one and verify, ideally chain having full blobs. (And do this in a simulator that runs for all CL pairs)
